title-group.article-title: Momentum Portfolios and the Capital Asset Pricing Model: A Bayesian Approach

abstract.p: I use a Bayesian methodology developed by Pástor (2000) to examine the strength of the momentum effect first reported by Jegadeesh and Titman (1993). Using data for 1926 through 2009, I examine the portfolio choices of hypothetical mean-variance investors who allocate wealth between the market portfolio and a momentum portfolio. These investors have different prior beliefs about the ability of the CAPM to price the momentum portfolio. Not surprisingly, investors with less prior confidence in the CAPM eventually allocate more to the momentum portfolio. Somewhat surprisingly, however, an investor with near complete confidence in the CAPM still would have allocated a substantial percentage to the momentum portfolio.
